column4: ere4si-> would I be able to modify the last mbr written within grub> like  root hd0,1  and then setup hd0,1  ?
ere4si-> maybe time to update your knowhow, want to try this "setup" within grub prompt?
ere4si-> yes, correct, but grub can be re-installed into mbr right?

grub is a 2 part thing... you can have another bootloader load grub (that would be the mbr), or grub can also be used as a bootloader (then it would be the mbr)... grub, and grub mbr are 2 seperate things
could someone with smb knowledge look at http://pastebin.com/m2d437388 for me... especially [public]
todd_-> okay, i know its a 2 part thing, its complaining that it cant find the correct stage1.5, so i need to update whatever is in the mbr with the correct stage 1.5
installing grub, just installs the application, you need to rewrite your mbr with the grub mbr
bakar: sorry, i'm not a grub expert, do know a bit about the mbr though
todd_-> and is that done via  grub-install command?
Dont know did you read man grub?
todd_-> yes, its just unclear on this part about using grub-instal
you could also install ubuntu, only exit after the actual install starts, should work... how i did it
bakar: if you'd like another way, WhuutdupNumba2 has ideas for you
where the heck are the ops?
